subject: Re: Integrating Jemmy and JUnit
msgSnippet: ... within a ... I m not sure what you mean by Jemmy scenario .. I ll do a bit more research as time permits. What I ve done is use the Jemmy wrappers etc. to
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Johannes Link" <john.link@g...> wrote:
> > > Has anyone tried and succeeded in integrating Jemmy
> > > (jemmy.netbeans.org) with JUnit?
> >
> > I haven't integrated it to the extent you indicate, but I do use Jemmy
> > at the API level from JUnit tests.
>
> So how do you determine the success or failure of a Jemmy scenario
within a
> JUnit test case?

I'm not sure what you mean by "Jemmy scenario".. I'll do a bit more
research as time permits.

What I've done is use the Jemmy wrappers etc. to manipulate/query the
UI from withing a test... set it up, do something, assert the results.
If there are structural failures (e.g. a certain widget can't be
found) Jemmy throws an excption with the test runner catches & reports
as an error.

I use the approach in my TDD/JUnit book... I'm looking forward to
comparing our approaches.

Dave
